q: Allen Iverson 's biggest assist to Chris Webber didn't come on a no-look pass. It came in words of encouragement to Philly's slumping newcomer. "Just get your swagger back," Chris Webber said Allen Iverson told him. That's really what I did. It helped me out. I think it"s huge. I just think it needs a little place to go. So we built a little place for it to go. But should Mike Pence , who has said he will decide this month on his next step, listen to his fans, or choose the safer route of running for governor?

Verizon is offering the 16-gigabyte iPhone 4 for$ 199.99 and the 32GB version for$ 299 for 32 GB with a two-year service contract. They're being supplanted by these online social sites. And they're all selling ads, even the dating sites. The only surprise would have been if Facebook wasn't selling ads. What will be interesting is how they will police their ads. They don't want to get into a situation like Craigslist. returns from visit with Gabrielle Giffords Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand ( D-N.Y.) returned Monday from Houston, where she visited with Rep. Gabrielle Giffords ( D-Ariz.), who is recovering from a gunshot wound to the head. Returned fr Houston today. Gabrielle Giffords continues to defy the odds& is so appreciative of all your support. Pls cont to keep her in your prayers, Kirsten Gillibrand posted on her Twitter account. Gabrielle Giffords was shot in the head at close range during a public event in Tucson, Ariz., on Jan. 8. Kay Bailey Hutchison Kirsten Gillibrand ( D-N. Y) and Rep. Debbie Wasserman-Schultz( D-Fla.) talk about the moment Gabrielle Giffords opened her eyes for the first time.", "note":

This move is a big one for ol' Google, as Eric Schmidt , Page and Sergey Brin have long run the company as a trio, an approach Page articulated quite clearly in the company's 2004 IPO filing: We run Google as a triumvirate. The three of us run the company collaboratively with Sergey Brin and me as presidents. The structure is unconventional, but we have worked successfully in this way. Though it goes against Google's well-worn techniques, Shmidt claims the reorganization won't hurt the company's mojo. In fact, he believes the new management structure will speed up the decision making process.
